intro: Asperula azerbaidjanica, commonly known as the Caucasian azalea, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and rhododendrons, and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring. Its leaves are dark green, glossy, and oval-shaped, providing a striking contrast to the floral display. Asperula azerbaidjanica is adapted to acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partially shaded to sunny conditions.
